snippet: The parents of Ashya King, 5, who has a brain tumor, attended an extradition hearing in Spain, where they had taken their son after leaving a British hospital against doctors’ orders.
abstract: Spanish judge orders Brett and Naghemeh King back into police custody pending further examination of their case, as well as a report from a hospital in Malaga where their 5-year-old son Ashya is being treated; British police issued a European arrest warrant for the Kings, who are seeking treatment for their son's brain tumor, for taking him out of the hospital there, on charges of parental neglect.

byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: The parents of Ashya King, 5, who has a brain tumor, attended an extradition hearing in Spain, where they had taken their son after leaving a British hospital against doctors’ orders.

headline.main: Parents Who Left Britain With Ill Son Fight Order to Return
headline.print_headline: Parents Who Left Britain With Ill Son Fight Order to Return
